4. Has the mother started breastfeeding the baby?
5. Has she started her regular diet?
6. Are there any other complaints?
51
B. Examination
 ∙ Check the woman’s pulse, blood pressure, temperature, and respiratory rate.
 ∙ Check for the presence of pallor.
 ∙ Conduct an abdominal examination. Normally, the uterus will be well contracted, i.e., hard and round. If it is 
soft and uterine tenderness is present, then refer the woman to the FRU.
